request.description:
This endpoint retrieves a list of users with pagination support. It accepts a query parameter 'page' to specify the page number of results to fetch.

### Request

- Method: GET
- Endpoint: https://reqres.in/api/users
    
- Query Parameters:
    - page (number): Specifies the page number of results to fetch.

### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Body:
    
    ``` json
        {
          "page": 0,
          "per_page": 0,
          "total": 0,
          "total_pages": 0,
          "data": [
            {
              "id": 0,
              "email": "",
              "first_name": "",
              "last_name": "",
              "avatar": ""
            }
          ],
          "support": {
            "url": "",
            "text": ""
          }
        }
    
     ```
    

The response contains pagination information and an array of user data objects, each with 'id', 'email', 'first_name', 'last_name', and 'avatar' fields. The 'support' object provides additional support information with 'url' and 'text' fields.

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of users with an optional delay of 3 seconds. The response will include pagination details such as page number, items per page, total count, total pages, and an array of user data containing their IDs, email addresses, first names, last names, and avatars. Additionally, the response includes support information with URL and text details.

To use this endpoint, simply make an HTTP GET request to the specified URL with an optional delay query parameter.

Example:

```
https://reqres.in/api/users?delay=3

 ```

request.description:
This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to fetch user details based on the provided user ID. The request should be made to https://reqres.in/api/users/2. The response will have a status code of 200, and it will include the user's data along with support information.

The response will contain the user's ID, email, first name, last name, and avatar. Additionally, the response will also include support information with a URL and text.

No request body is required for this GET request.

exec: pm.test("Response has the required fields - name, job, id, and createdAt", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new user by sending a POST request to the specified URL. The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body type with the keys "name" and "job".

### Request Body
- `name` (string, required): The name of the user.
- `job` (string, required): The job title of the user.

Upon a successful execution, the response will have a status code of 201, indicating that the user has been created. The response body will include the details of the newly created user, including the `name`, `job`, `id`, and `createdAt` properties.

### Response
- `name` (string): The name of the user.
- `job` (string): The job title of the user.
- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the user.
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the user was created.

exec: pm.test("Name value should not be empty", function () {
pm.test("Job value should be a string", function () {

request.description:
This API endpoint allows you to update user information by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request should include the user ID in the URL path and the updated user details in the request body.

### Request Body
- `name` (string, optional): The updated name of the user.
- `job` (string, optional): The updated job title of the user.

### Response
Upon a successful execution of the request, the server will respond with a status code of 200 and a JSON object containing the updated user information, including the `name`, `job`, and `updatedAt` fields.

Example:
```json
{
    "name": "",
    "job": "",
    "updatedAt": ""
}
```

request.description:
This API endpoint allows users to register by sending a POST request to the specified URL. The request should include the user's email and password in the request body.

### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email of the user.
- password (string, required): The password for the user account.
    

### Response

- id (number): The unique identifier for the registered user.
- token (string): The authentication token for the registered user.
    

Upon successful registration, the server will respond with a status code of 200 and provide the user's ID and authentication token in the response body.

This endpoint is used to register a new user. When making a POST request to https://reqres.in/api/register, the request should include a raw body with the user's email in the payload.

### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email of the user to be registered.
    

### Response

The endpoint returns a status code of 400 in case of an error, along with an error message in the response body.

Example:

```
{
    "error": "Error message here"
}

 ```

pm.test("Token should not be empty", function () {

request.description:
This API endpoint is used to authenticate and login a user. Upon successful authentication, the server returns a token which can be used for further authorized requests.

### Request Body

- email (text, required): The email address of the user.
- password (text, required): The password of the user.
    

### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- token (string): The authentication token for the user.

exec: pm.test("Error message is a non-empty string", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint is used to authenticate and login a user. The HTTP POST request should be made to https://reqres.in/api/login with the user's email provided in the request body.

### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email of the user trying to login.
    

### Response

- Status: 400
- error (string): A message indicating the reason for the login failure.
